The CFL had canceled its 2020 season and focused on the best ways to ensure the safety of its players and fans during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. However, now the 2021 season has started and they have taken the following measures to ensure the safety of its players and fans:

1. A bio-secure protocol: The CFL has developed a comprehensive bio-secure protocol to reduce the potential spread of COVID-19 between players and staff.

2. Regular testing: Players and staff are tested regularly for COVID-19, and any confirmed cases are immediately addressed with contact tracing and quarantine measures.

3. Isolation: Players and staff members are kept in isolation bubbles to minimize exposure to the virus.

4. Mask-wearing: Players and staff members are required to wear masks at all times except during play.

5. Limited fan attendance: The CFL has limited the number of fans that can attend games, and social distancing measures have been put in place for fan seating arrangements in stadiums.

6. Enhanced cleaning protocols: The league has enhanced cleaning protocols for training facilities, team equipment, and high-traffic areas at stadiums.

7. Daily symptom checks: Players and staff members are required to perform daily symptom checks to monitor for potential COVID-19 symptoms.

Overall, the CFL is implementing stringent measures to ensure the safety of its players and fans during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, and it's important to note that these guidelines are subject to change based on the emerging COVID-19 situation.
